image.altText: a group of about 15 police officers standing together in the cbd

props.synopsis: The NT police minister confirmed a decision on whether to extend the Alice Springs curfew will be made on Thursday morning, after the lock-out restrictions expire.

title.children: Violent brawl breaks out in Alice Springs ahead of curfew decision

image.altText: Bald man standing in front of aboriginal artwork

props.synopsis: The head of a remote Northern Territory land council, Mark Hewitt, has been referred to the National Anti-Corruption Commission due to allegations of conflicts of interest.

title.children: Land council boss accused of misusing millions referred to anti-corruption commission

image.altText: An embossed metal sign on a building that reads "Department of Education".

props.synopsis: A "psychopathic" paedophile, who later boasted of sexually abusing 2,000 boys, was employed as a Victorian Education Department school teacher despite declaring in a 1970s job application form that he was a convicted child abuser.

title.children: 'Psychopathic' paedophile was given teaching job despite declaring abuse conviction on application

image.altText: MDMA tablet

props.synopsis: The Australian Criminal Intelligence Commission has revealed Australia's use of cocaine, methylamphetamine and nicotine is on the up, but cannabis remains the illicit drug of choice.

title.children: Here's what a new illicit drug report is revealing about Australian's drug habits

image.altText: Silhouette of man in front of green screen displaying a Linux command window.

props.synopsis: Australia's cyber intelligence agency says a Chinese government-backed hacking group known as APT 40 has been targeting government and private sector networks here and around the region. But what exactly is an "APT" and what do they do?

title.children: Australia has accused China of backing a cyber espionage group. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: A stylised image shows an identikit face of an older man over a corkboard background

props.synopsis: Today marks 30 years since the body of a tall, well-dressed man was pulled from the waters off Germany. Investigators hoping tip-offs from Australia and genetic mapping may help crack the case.

title.children: A cold ocean, a mystery man and a DNA surprise — why Australians may hold the key to a 30-year-old cold case

image.altText: Queensland Police Service logo on shoulder sleeve of officer's shirt.

props.synopsis: The CCTV footage seen by the ABC's 7.30 shows an officer striking a 17-year-old Indigenous boy with a baton three times until his legs give way and he falls to the floor.

title.children: Former watch house officers 'sickened' by video of Queensland police beating teen with batons in his cell

image.altText: Alex de Minaur slides to hit a forehand during a tennis match at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: As Alex de Minaur sat and spoke about the dangers of sliding on grass, he had an inkling his Wimbledon campaign might have been ended by doing just that.

title.children: The painfully prophetic words that came back to haunt Alex de Minaur

image.altText: Xavi Simons and Bukayo Saka battle for the ball

props.synopsis: England dominate possession after a stunning Xavi Simons goal gives the Dutch the lead, followed by a fortuitously awarded penalty converted by Harry Kane. Follow live.

title.children: England dominating Dutch in Euros semifinal, but teams all square at half-time

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Half time: England on top in level-pegging semifinal

image.altText: an aboriginal man wearing a beanie squatting in the sun in front of a red building

props.synopsis: As Alice Springs approaches its third and potentially final night of a snap 72-hour curfew, frontline services say they're deeply concerned for those sleeping rough.

title.children: Alice Springs curfew targeting crime exposes underlying homelessness crisis, services say

image.altText: A large fire on the roof of a factory, shown from the air.

props.synopsis: A factory fire sparked by a chemical explosion has been brought under control, but authorities say they expect it to burn for days.

title.children: 'Fireball' explosions and flying debris seen at site of Melbourne factory fire

image.altText: Older lady sits at kitchen table with a mug in front of her

props.synopsis: The signs of malnutrition in older Australians might be more familiar than you think but they are often dismissed as a 'normal' part of ageing. Here's how some simple changes could help.

title.children: 'People can definitely fade away': The malnutrition signs in older loved ones to watch out for

image.altText: Suburban street scene from above

props.synopsis: It's a Victorian tax hitting up investors sitting on empty residential properties — but analysis suggests it could be missing roughly 90 per cent of so-called "ghost homes" eligible for the charge, less than a year out from a planned expansion of the levy.

title.children: Why Victoria's vacant homes tax could be missing most of the empty properties owned by investors

image.altText: Hubble image of Omega Centauri

props.synopsis: Astronomers catalogued 1.4 million stars to find the black hole, 18,000 light-years from our solar system in the Milky Way.

title.children: A black hole 20,000 times bigger than the sun could help us understand how galaxies evolved

image.altText: A photo showing Jacob, with three legs, walking at night time.

props.synopsis: A record-breaking swim by two lion brothers, one an amputee, across a predator-infested African river is being held up as an example of how animals are making tough decisions to find homes and mates in a human-dominated world.

title.children: Cameras capture lions' 'record-breaking' swim through crocodile-infested waters

image.altText: boxes of lemons and apples fill the frame of this photo

props.synopsis: Families and neighbours shopping through informal co-ops are saving hundreds, but the business model could help apply major competitive pressure to the major supermarkets.

title.children: There is a cheaper alternative to supermarkets, but most people don't know it exists

image.altText: Alex de Minaur gestures with his hand after winning a match at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: Australian hopeful Alex de Minaur has pulled out of Wimbledon with a hip injury, just hours before he was due to play Novak Djokovic in his first quarter-final at the All England Club.

title.children: Alex de Minaur denied Wimbledon showdown with Novak Djokovic by 'freak injury'

image.altText: Three police officers hold down an Indigenous teenage boy while another officer stands behind them and looks on.

props.synopsis: 7.30 has obtained footage showing police beating an Indigenous youth repeatedly with a baton in a watch house, sparking allegations of excessive use of force.

title.children: 'Abhorrent and distressing': Multiple police beat teenager locked in watch house

image.altText: Mountain rescue stand on snowy peak with body on stretcher

props.synopsis: A climber discovered the body of a man buried in an avalanche in the Huascaran peak 22 years ago while he was making his own ascent.

title.children: Climber finds body of man buried in Peru avalanche 22 years ago

image.altText: A police tent and forensic officer

props.synopsis: Three women are killed at a property near London as police search for a man armed with a crossbow.

title.children: Three women killed in UK home as police search for crossbow attacker

image.altText: A man leaves court wearing a mask

props.synopsis: A 71-year-old who wrote homophobic slurs to Alex Greenwich has, after lying to police and a court mental health application, received a two-year good behaviour bond.

title.children: Retiree who sent homophobic letter to Sydney MP convicted as magistrate rejects 'junk mail' claim

image.altText: WA CWA 100 years

props.synopsis: Western Australia's CWA branches have welcomed men into their ranks after 100 years, with members voting almost unanimously to grant men membership rights.

title.children: It's taken 100 years, but these women have voted to allow men into the Country Women's Association

image.altText: Man wearing sunglasses in front of the ocean

props.synopsis: Geraldton man Matthew Watson had a bad feeling when his friend didn't return to the boat during a spearfishing trip near Coral Bay on Monday. Then, he spotted him bleeding in the water.

title.children: 'I've been hit': Man describes pulling mate bitten by shark from waters off remote WA coast

image.altText: Filicide study

props.synopsis: About 20 children are murdered by a parent every year in Australia. It's a crime that evokes equal measures of horror and confusion. At the crux of the issue is male-perpetrated violence.

title.children: The psychology behind filicide — explaining the unexplainable

image.altText: A Caucasian woman wearing red lipstick, winged eyeliner and a red round hat smiles in a selfie

props.synopsis: The Irish prime minister says he will intervene to help a 28-year-old flight attendant detained in Dubai under "the most appalling of circumstances".

title.children: Irish woman detained for 'attempting suicide' in UAE, Irish PM to intervene

image.altText: Snakes lie on top of each other in a plastic bag which sits on a metal table

props.synopsis: Chinese officials stopped the man and found the reptiles — including milk snakes and corn snakes — in bags inside his pockets.

title.children: Man caught trying to smuggle more than 100 live snakes inside his trousers

image.altText: Two men walking away from the NT Local Court.

props.synopsis: Neil Mellon has been sentenced to eight months behind bars after pleading guilty to a string of offences, including destroying evidence related to a 2022 helicopter crash that killed Netflix star Chris ‘Willow’ Wilson.

title.children: Former NT police officer jailed for destroying evidence after chopper crash that killed Netflix star

image.altText: Tourists look at the Eiffel Tower from afar. One girl is wearing a red beret and another is holding up an iphone.

props.synopsis: The Australian dollar is gaining strength and that can influence everything from the pace of inflation to the cost of your next overseas trip.

title.children: The Aussie dollar has hit a six-month high — and some analysts predict it could get stronger

image.altText: A bespectacled man with a grey goatee wears a blue top as he sits with his arms on a table in front of him.

props.synopsis: Within a year of landing her first full-time teaching job, Oh Jae Geun's daughter took her own life after overzealous parents ruthlessly scrutinised her performance and threatened to make criminal complaints to the police.

title.children: Oh Jae Geun's daughter was a teacher. After her death, he found shocking stories about parents in her phone

image.altText: A man in an overcoat walks up the stairs to the Reserve Bank of New Zealand's headquarters in Wellington.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank of New Zealand has kept interest rates on hold for another meeting but predicted inflation will return to target in the second half of the year. Meanwhile, the ASX ended lower at the close of trade on Wednesday.

title.children: Reserve Bank of New Zealand leaves interest rates on hold at 5.5pc, ASX ends lower — as it happened

image.altText: Luna is smiling at the camera and holding a toy unicorn

props.synopsis: Australian children with a rare form of cancer known as neuroblastoma will no longer need to spend $500,000 and travel to the US for treatment, as the federal government agrees to cover costs immediately while the drug gets local approvals.

title.children: Children with rare cancer given free access to treatment at home, after previously being forced to travel to US for $500,000 drug

image.altText: New research examines prevalence of sexual violence perpetration in Australia

props.synopsis: A new study finds "shocking" levels of perpetrating sexual violence among Australians aged 18 to 45, with men the main offenders.

title.children: 1 in 5 Australians admit to perpetrating acts of sexual violence, from harassing someone for a date to sexual assault

image.altText: Soldiers dressed un uniform, holding instruments, ready to start the Anzac Day march in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The ban follows a review that found that the majority of people supported full-day trade restrictions during Australia's national day of remembrance as a way of better recognising ex-servicemen and women.

title.children: Retailers hit back at NSW plan to ban shops opening on Anzac Day

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair with red lipstick on

props.synopsis: The Kremlin issues arrest warrant for Yulia Navalnaya, who has been living in exile since the death of her late husband Alexei Navalny in a Russian penal colony earlier this year.

title.children: Russia orders arrest of jailed opposition leader's widow Yulia Navalnaya

image.altText: A man with his head bandaged and a pained expression sits on a hospital floor next to a young boy

props.synopsis: Palestinian officials say an Israeli air strike in southern Gaza has killed dozens of people while advancing tanks in Gaza City forced residents to flee under fire as Israel stepped up an offensive that Hamas warned could jeopardise ceasefire talks.

title.children: 'Gaza City is being wiped out': Residents flee under fire as Israeli tanks advance in renewed campaign
